intro: Sciaphila maboroensis, commonly known as the Maboro shade plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the island of Borneo. This plant is characterized by its unique, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-draining, nutrient-rich soil. Sciaphila maboroensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is appreciated for its ability to bloom in low-light conditions.
